cont.entity_a: The card does not work on RedHat 5.5 or Xubuntu 9.04 Linux due to driver errors.
cont.entity_b: The Atheros chipset works well in Linux. The card did not work with Fedora Linux and had installation issues.

cont.entity_a: Installation was quick with the CD.
cont.entity_b: Drivers installed from the CD-ROM. The card installed easily and worked immediately.

cont.entity_a: The card loses connection frequently, even when close to the router.
cont.entity_b: The card provides fast throughput with an Apple router. The card connects at 108Mbps with a D-Link router. The card offers good wireless range and improved connection. The card is reliable and easy to connect.

cont.entity_a: The management software provided did not work, requiring manual management.
The card worked well with a Linksys wireless router. The card had poor range and stability issues. Transmission speed is not faster in N-mode compared to Cisco G-mode.
cont.entity_b: The card is suitable for close-to-the-router usage but not for roaming.

cont.entity_a: TrendNet's customer service is very good.
The previous version of the TrendNet card worked well, but this one has stability problems.

CompatibilityWithOS.comm: The card works well with Windows XP and Ubuntu.

cont.entity_b: It works great with various Linux distributions and older hardware.
